subject: Science
title: From Water to Land
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on From Water to Land.

hook.text: About 375 million years ago, a fish crawled out of the water and never went back.

buildup.text: Fish with sturdy fins began propping themselves up in shallow water.

discovery.text: Tiktaalik, discovered in 2004, had a fish body but wrist-like joints and a flat head.

twist.text: Moving to land meant solving new problems: gravity, drying out, and breathing air.

climax.text: Those early land animals evolved into every amphibian, reptile, bird, and mammal alive today.

punchline.text: Every land animal exists because one fish was brave enough to leave the water.

quiz.question: What is significant about the fossil Tiktaalik?
options: It shows features of both fish and land animals
It's the oldest fossil ever found
It proves dinosaurs evolved from birds
